title: BOARDWALK / WCH
description: Dead working class husband who has fallen through the blanks and cut himself open and it's generally a very gruesome and sad death.

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Corpse: "A man lies on the boardwalk, his li..."
dialogueTree.text: A man lies on the boardwalk, his limbs bent and neck turned at an unnatural angle. Right next to him is an empty bottle of spirits. In his cramped hand: a chewing gum wrapper.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hold on..." The lieutenant leans o..."
links.text: "Hold on..." The lieutenant leans over the corpse and examines his face. Two glassy eyes stare back at him, void of any signs of life.
"Looks like he's been dead for a while. I'm surprised no one found him before you came along." He stands up and shivers as a gust of wind blows through his bomber jacket.

links.title: You: "Study the man's clothes."
links.text: Study the man's clothes.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "He's wearing mud-caked boots, beige..."
links.text: He's wearing mud-caked boots, beige trousers and an old brown leather jacket with a bright blue lining. There are traces of kebab sauce on his chest.

links.title: Composure: "The leather jacket suits him well...."
links.text: The leather jacket suits him well. It must be custom-made.

links.title: Logic: "A cool leather jacket with a bolt o..."
links.text: A cool leather jacket with a bolt of blue? Oh no, this sounds terribly familiar...

links.title: You: "Search his pockets."
links.text: Search his pockets.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "Only some sunflower seeds remain in..."
links.text: Only some sunflower seeds remain in his soaked pockets. You already took the library card.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should take another look at the..."
links.text: "We should take another look at the library card you found on him," the lieutenant says, straightening his back.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good, we should take a look at tha..."
links.text: "Good, we should take a look at that library card after this is done."

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "You find some sunflower seeds and a..."
links.text: You find some sunflower seeds and a rain-soaked library card, folded into two. His jacket feels sodden and heavy under your hand.

links.title: You: "Study the man himself."
links.text: Study the man himself.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "The man has fallen through a crack..."
links.text: The man has fallen through a crack in the boardwalk and hit his head against the metal bench. Coagulated blood covers his black hair. One of his feet is still dangling through the hole.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You have to be quite inebriated to..."
links.text: You have to be quite inebriated to fall that bad. Well over a litre of pure ethanol. Three bottles of wine or one and a half of spirits?

links.title: Logic: "Or maybe it was just dark."
links.text: Or maybe it was just dark.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "When damp these boards are really s..."
links.text: When damp these boards are really slippery, even a sober man could loose their balance here.

links.title: You: "Examine his face."
links.text: Examine his face.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "His expression is dull like the sea..."
links.text: His expression is dull like the sea behind him, drops of water shining on his moustache. His eyes, empty and wide, look frightening in their frozen gaze.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Height: 170-175 cm, curly hair, sto..."
links.text: Height: 170-175 cm, curly hair, stout build. Age: approximately 50-60 years.

links.title: Empathy: "He was confused when he died. Confu..."
links.text: He was confused when he died. Confused and alone, most likely. Overcome with the awful surprise of it all.

links.title: Inland Empire: "He was *just* about to head home. T..."
links.text: He was *just* about to head home. The first step back home proved to be his last.

links.title: Logic: "That's what the chewing gum seems t..."
links.text: That's what the chewing gum seems to point to as well.

links.title: Logic: "A bad fall. It might have been dark..."
links.text: A bad fall. It might have been dark outside? This place is a mine field in the dark.

links.title: You: "Study the surroundings."
links.text: Study the surroundings.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "There's some dried blood on the met..."
links.text: There's some dried blood on the metal bench, right where the corpse's head rests. The floorboards are rotten and slippery wet around the hole. An empty bottle lies nearby. A chewing gum wrapper is clutched in his fist.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Be very, very careful where you ste..."
links.text: Be very, very careful where you step here.

links.title: You: "Examine the man's head."
links.text: Examine the man's head.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "A dried chunk of blood covers the h..."
links.text: A dried chunk of blood covers the hair at the back of his head -- an open wound. It's sticky and cold to your touch.

links.title: Logic: "This is what killed him."
links.text: This is what killed him.

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is where he came out of himsel..."
links.text: This is where he came out of himself. Drop by drop when he was unconscious. It took three, maybe four minutes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't see any other major wounds..."
links.text: "I don't see any other major wounds. Do you?"

links.title: You: ""It's hard to say.""
links.text: "It's hard to say."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Seems like the head wound was fata..."
links.text: "Seems like the head wound was fatal. It's exactly the shape of the bench..."

links.title: You: ""No, just this one at the back of h..."
links.text: "No, just this one at the back of his head."

links.title: You: "Step on the floorboards."
links.text: Step on the floorboards.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "They screech under your feet, omino..."
links.text: They screech under your feet, ominously. It's hard to say whether the dead man's weight was what caused the boardwalk to break... It definitely looks fragile.

links.title: Perception: "You see waves churning below... Som..."
links.text: You see waves churning below... Something cracks beneath your feet.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "He could have easily disappeared in..."
links.text: He could have easily disappeared into the sea through that hole. And you would have never found him.

links.title: You: "Examine the bottle."
links.text: Examine the bottle.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "A 0.75 litre 'Touloula' vodka with..."
links.text: A 0.75 litre 'Touloula' vodka with its cap missing. There's hardly anything left inside.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It's mid-market spirits. With a sli..."
links.text: It's mid-market spirits. With a slight touch of menthol. The man meant to enjoy himself, have a good time.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Tare, all around us..." He looks a..."
links.text: "Tare, all around us..." He looks at two other bottles near the coin-operated viewer, then at your yellow plastic bag.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'd prefer if you didn't collect t..."
links.text: "I'd prefer if you didn't collect them this time. It's not... proper."

links.title: Inland Empire: "True. It feels... disrespectful."
links.text: True. It feels... disrespectful.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Tare, all around us..." He looks a..."
links.text: "Tare, all around us..." He looks at two other bottles forgotten near the coin-operated viewer.

links.title: You: "Examine the chewing gum wrapper."
links.text: Examine the chewing gum wrapper.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "'Rubowski' spearmint chewing gum. G..."
links.text: 'Rubowski' spearmint chewing gum. Green leaves on the cover. The man's mouth is half-agape from the terror of the fall...

links.title: You: "Look in."
links.text: Look in.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "The blackness of death. Stench. You..."
links.text: The blackness of death. Stench. You think you see white chewing gum too.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Confirmed. Nearly the whole pack is..."
links.text: Confirmed. Nearly the whole pack is there, solidified on his lower rear teeth.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He ate the whole pack, right? It's..."
links.text: "He ate the whole pack, right? It's to cover the smell of alcohol before going home. The worst thing is..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shudders from the co..."
links.text: The lieutenant shudders from the cold. "I've seen it before: almost the same scenario. Even the chewing gum. It's always the same..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "In a ditch off a road below the 8/8..."
links.text: In a ditch off a road below the 8/81, he thinks. A young father. Then he shakes his head, to make the memory stop.

links.title: Logic: "To hide the stench of alcohol no do..."
links.text: To hide the stench of alcohol no doubt.

links.title: You: "Back off."
links.text: Back off.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "Careful. The wind blows hard, from..."
links.text: Careful. The wind blows hard, from the east.

links.title: You: "Step back."
links.text: Step back.

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "The entire boardwalk creaks in the..."
links.text: The entire boardwalk creaks in the wind as you take a step back.

links.title: You: "What should I do with the body?"
links.text: What should I do with the body?

links.title: Working Class Corpse: "First you need to talk with the lie..."
links.text: First you need to talk with the lieutenant, then report back to the station. This is too complicated to handle on your own.

links.title: You: ""Who is this man?""
links.text: "Who is this man?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like one of the locals -- he..."
links.text: "Looks like one of the locals -- he'd have to know this spot to come here. You don't *just* walk over here." He looks south, the way you came.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But that's just a lazy assumption...."
links.text: "But that's just a lazy assumption. What do you think?"

links.title: Logic: "A dead working class man with a bot..."
links.text: A dead working class man with a bottle in his hand? Don't deceive yourself, you know who this is.

links.title: You: ""We know who this is. It's the work..."
links.text: "We know who this is. It's the working class woman's missing husband -- dead on the boardwalk."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The woman you met at the bookstand..."
links.text: "The woman you met at the bookstand?" He looks at the bundle of flesh and rags lying on the ground. "Why do you think it's her husband?"

links.title: Conceptualization: "Because it's the most working class..."
links.text: Because it's the most working class death you've ever seen.

links.title: You: ""This is the most working class way..."
links.text: "This is the most working class way to go -- completely alienated and forgotten."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, yes," the lieutenant seems im..."
links.text: "Yes, yes," the lieutenant seems impatient, "but what *actual* facts do you have that connect him with this woman you met at the bookstand?"

links.title: You: ""The leather jacket." (Point at the..."
links.text: "The leather jacket." (Point at the man's clothes.) "It matches her description perfectly."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The bright blue lining?" He nods,..."
links.text: "The bright blue lining?" He nods, then points at the ring on the man's left hand: "Well, he's definitely *someone's* husband."

links.title: You: ""Bottles, all around him." (Point a..."
links.text: "Bottles, all around him." (Point at the tare.) "She said he was drinking somewhere in Martinaise."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, he's definitely *someone's*..."
links.text: "Well, he's definitely *someone's* husband." The lieutenant points at the golden ring on the man's left hand, the flesh around it swollen and pale.

links.title: You: ""The library card! He was supposed..."
links.text: "The library card! He was supposed to return a book."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can't see a book..." The lieuten..."
links.text: "I can't see a book..." The lieutenant pats his pockets. "So he took the book to the library, then came back and thought -- I'll have one."

links.title: Logic: "I'll have *one* drink before I get..."
links.text: I'll have *one* drink before I get home.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Just one drink. I have my cool jack..."
links.text: Just one drink. I have my cool jacket on. I took the book to the library. I've earned it.

links.title: Inland Empire: "The view from the lookout is beauti..."
links.text: The view from the lookout is beautiful...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Damn it... He's definitely *someon..."
links.text: "Damn it... He's definitely *someone's* husband." The lieutenant points at the golden ring on the man's left hand, the flesh around it swollen and pale.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "At least this man knew how to party..."
links.text: At least this man knew how to party! Imagine the same scene without the bottle -- now that would be just sad.

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is an omen, a sign from above..."
links.text: This is an omen, a sign from above -- that you need to stop drinking.

links.title: You: ""He looks like me. I could have end..."
links.text: "He looks like me. I could have ended up just like him -- dead on some empty boardwalk with a bottle next to my corpse."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, at least you're not married...."
links.text: "Well, at least you're not married." The lieutenant points at the ring on the man's left hand, the flesh around it swollen and grey.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Or what if you are...?"
links.text: Or what if you are...?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Married to your drink, that's for s..."
links.text: Married to your drink, that's for sure.

links.title: You: ""What we're witnessing here is a de..."
links.text: "What we're witnessing here is a demise of a great party beast. That leather jacket, an empty vodka bottle..." (Kiss your fingers.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The wedding ring." The lieutenant..."
links.text: "The wedding ring." The lieutenant points at the ring on the man's left hand, the flesh around it swollen and grey.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But let's try to not run ahead --..."
links.text: "But let's try to not run ahead -- for now all we know is that he's an unidentified middle-aged man found dead on the Martinaise boardwalk."

links.title: You: ""Looks like just another old drunka..."
links.text: "Looks like just another old drunkard to me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And he was married." The lieutenan..."
links.text: "And he was married." The lieutenant points at the ring on the man's left hand, the flesh around it swollen and grey.

links.title: You: ""I think labelling him as an alcoho..."
links.text: "I think labelling him as an alcoholic is a bit premature. We don't know anything yet."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We do know that he was married." T..."
links.text: "We do know that he was married." The lieutenant points at the ring on the man's left hand, the flesh around it swollen and grey.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But you're right, let's not run ah..."
links.text: "But you're right, let's not run ahead. For now all we know is that he's an unidentified middle-aged man found dead on the Martinaise boardwalk."

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is an omen, a sign from above..."
links.text: This is an omen, a sign from above -- don't start drinking again.

links.title: You: ""What do you think happened here?""
links.text: "What do you think happened here?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Death by misadventure. He slipped..."
links.text: "Death by misadventure. He slipped and fell through the boardwalk. A truly unfortunate accident... If it wouldn't have been for that bench, he'd be alive."

links.title: You: ""Could it be related to the lynchin..."
links.text: "Could it be related to the lynching?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, I don't see anything that poin..."
links.text: "No, I don't see anything that points in that direction. For now let's treat this case as a simple -- albeit sad -- accident, unrelated to the murder case."

links.title: Half Light: "Yes, but what if there's a killer o..."
links.text: Yes, but what if there's a killer on the loose? Two suspicious deaths in such a short time frame!

links.title: You: ""We should consider the possibility..."
links.text: "We should consider the possibility that we're dealing with a sequence killer here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A *sequence killer*?" The lieutena..."
links.text: "A *sequence killer*?" The lieutenant narrows his eyes in the wind. "There's nothing that connects those two bodies. This is a completely different case -- an accident."

links.title: Inland Empire: "What if all of this is staged? He c..."
links.text: What if all of this is staged? He could have seen something that night in the yard...

links.title: You: ""What if he *witnessed* something?..."
links.text: "What if he *witnessed* something? All of this could be staged. We don't know the exact cause of death."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's possible, but let's take it s..."
links.text: "It's possible, but let's take it step-by-step. We still haven't identified the man."

links.title: You: ""Someone could have pushed him from..."
links.text: "Someone could have pushed him from behind with an intention to kill."

links.title: You: ""I'm just saying that we should be..."
links.text: "I'm just saying that we should be open to all possibilities."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, but... I just wanted to make..."
links.text: "Yes, but... I just wanted to make it clear it's not a sequence killer, okay?"

links.title: You: ""You're right, connecting it with t..."
links.text: "You're right, connecting it with the lynching is a stretch."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Without any further evidence -- ye..."
links.text: "Without any further evidence -- yes."

links.title: Logic: "Agreed. If this somehow converges l..."
links.text: Agreed. If this somehow converges later, why not. But keep it simple for now.

links.title: You: ""Do you think he was drunk?" (Point..."
links.text: "Do you think he was drunk?" (Point at the bottle.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh yes," the lieutenant nods."
links.text: "Oh yes," the lieutenant nods.

links.title: You: ""What about alcohol poisoning and l..."
links.text: "What about alcohol poisoning and liver failure?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Some symptoms of acute alcohol poi..."
links.text: "Some symptoms of acute alcohol poisoning could have definitely played a role here: severe confusion, respiratory depression, unpredictable behaviour..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But I think that death arrived thr..."
links.text: "But I think that death arrived through head trauma, not liver failure."

links.title: You: ""What about the kebab?""
links.text: "What about the kebab?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What about it? The deceased ate so..."
links.text: "What about it? The deceased ate some kebab." He shrugs. "It's probably from a nearby place, maybe in the Pox..."

links.title: Logic: "Sometimes a kebab is just a kebab."
links.text: Sometimes a kebab is just a kebab.

links.title: You: ""Someone should be held responsible..."
links.text: "Someone should be held responsible for this broken boardwalk. It's dangerous."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They'll seal this place off after..."
links.text: "They'll seal this place off after the news reaches the Coalition officials. I doubt that they have enough resources to actually repair the boardwalk."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not that sealing it off would keep..."
links.text: "Not that sealing it off would keep anyone away. All it does is keep the city council's hands clean." He smiles sourly.

links.title: You: ""Right." (Conclude.)"
links.text: "Right." (Conclude.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It does seem to be a pretty straig..."
links.text: "It does seem to be a pretty straightforward misadventure, although there's still the question of identifying the body..."

links.title: You: ""What should we do with him?""
links.text: "What should we do with him?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""From where I stand I can see two o..."
links.text: "From where I stand I can see two options. We either take the case and follow the leads to identify the body on our own -- or we report back to the station and leave this for our colleagues to handle."

links.title: You: ""Hold on -- what about field autops..."
links.text: "Hold on -- what about field autopsy?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A field autopsy isn't necessary if..."
links.text: "A field autopsy isn't necessary if the cause of death doesn't appear to be criminal -- and this looks like a simple accident to me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'd say we should just write down..."
links.text: "I'd say we should just write down 'head trauma' and leave it at that. Let's keep this detour as short as possible -- the sooner we get back to finding Ruby the better."

links.title: You: ""Yes, but... isn't that kind of slo..."
links.text: "Yes, but... isn't that kind of sloppy?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe, but we don't really have mu..."
links.text: "Maybe, but we don't really have much time or resources to spare. The guys at Processing will take care of the rest."

links.title: You: ""You're right, I don't see anything..."
links.text: "You're right, I don't see anything criminal here. Let's leave it at that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good call. The guys at Processing..."
links.text: "Good call. The guys at Processing can take care of the rest."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'd say we should just write down..."
links.text: "I'd say we should just write down 'head trauma' in the autopsy report and leave it at that. It would save us at least two hours of unnecessary work."

links.title: You: ""We found him. We should finish thi..."
links.text: "We found him. We should finish this." (Take the case.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright. We've already examined th..."
links.text: "Alright. We've already examined the library card -- let's call the Jamrock Library from my Kineema, see if we can learn anything about this Billie Mjean."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And while we're there we should al..."
links.text: "And while we're there we should also call the station, let them know that we're taking the case."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright. We should first examine t..."
links.text: "Alright. We should first examine that library card you found. Then we can call the station from my Kineema, let them know we're taking the case."

links.title: You: ""Let's leave this case for the stat..."
links.text: "Let's leave this case for the station, I don't want to spend time on it." (Don't take the case.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright. The station is going to w..."
links.text: "Alright. The station is going to want details, however. We already examined the library card we found on the body -- good, that should be enough for the first lead."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The next thing to do is call the s..."
links.text: "The next thing to do is call the station from my Kineema and hand over the case. Then we can return to the murder investigation and be done with it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright. The station is going to w..."
links.text: "Alright. The station is going to want details, however. Let's examine that library card you found on the man's body, see if it has any clues. Then we can call the station from my Kineema and hand over the case."

links.title: You: ""I still need some time to decide h..."
links.text: "I still need some time to decide how I want to solve this case." (Return to this later.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No need to rush.""
links.text: "No need to rush."

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Working Class Corpse: "A man lies on the boardwalk, his li..."
dialogueTree.text: A man lies on the boardwalk, his limbs bent and neck turned at an unnatural angle. Right next to him is an empty bottle of spirits. In his cramped hand: a chewing gum wrapper.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Half of his body has slipped betwee..."
links.text: Half of his body has slipped between the cracked boardwalk, starting with the right leg. The fall has left him broken, contorted like a sad puppet.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "The smell is... not as bad as a two..."
links.text: The smell is... not as bad as a two-week-old corpse, but it's definitely heading there.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hold on..." The lieutenant squats..."
links.text: "Hold on..." The lieutenant squats next to the corpse and examines his face. Two bulging eyes stare back at him, void of any signs of life.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Lividity is faintly pronounced. Wh..."
links.text: "Lividity is faintly pronounced. Whoever this is, he's been dead for two days, no longer." He stands up and shivers as a gust of wind blows through his bomber jacket. "We need to investigate."

links.title: Authority: "Another dead body. This is your job..."
links.text: Another dead body. This is your job. Steel yourself.

links.title: Composure: "Calm now. Carefully. Just another d..."
links.text: Calm now. Carefully. Just another day, just another dead body. Breathe.
